qZFlHoNEySw2eDJ0NEi19g.text: Was here for happy hour and had three of the tacos for $1. There was pollo, carnitas, and pastor. And a margarita. For under $10. The margarita was delicious. The tacos were not the best... Very very salty. My friend also said the same thing, very salty. By the third taco, i couldn't eat anymore. Told the cashier that took our order. She said she'll test it but never said anything further to us. Wouldnt recommend it. Just the house margaritas.

h7uAlPvLovz_A_-amDL0xw.text: Awesome tacos!! Great if you want to have a beer or margarita instead of just a drive-thru street taco which are so prevalent in Phoenix.   $1 Taco Tuesday is a real deal!  I also tried the Pozole: YUMMMM

Vo8O3S6CUw3LBd8Si1wkAw.text: I came here for the first time and ordered The Super Nachos with steak.  Everything was pretty tasty and the steak in the nachos had a great flavor....the Pico was really spicy.  I'll be back, I'm dying to try the fajitas and tacos.  Great for a lunch time break.

t69-PwRnvikrjORncHDaxw.text: Back for the second night in a row. Best tacos I've had in a very long time. Very friendly service and excellent margaritas. All priced right!

kWRYMZpawRDf8aJwkEZFcg.text: I first walked in and there was nobody there, I caught a glimpse of someone in the back. Since I wasn't sure what I wanted, I didn't mind waiting. I settled on carne asada tacos and 1 fish taco. When the girl finally appeared, she took my order and I handed her my credit card. As she swiped it, she started talking to the girl behind me. I signed my reciept, assumed that was it and walked away to wait.  Carne Asada Street Tacos: They were good, the tortillas were nice and hot. Plentiful of meat. But I've had better...from a food truck no less. The green salsa I found was good but not spicy.  Fish Street Taco: The fish was great in flavor, from the little piece that was given to me. I had to remove half the cabbage before taking a bite. It seemed they were making up for the lack of fish with cabbage.  The bar area was really nice, it looked almost like a club. Flat screen was playing golf.  Regardless, I wouldn't be returning here.

xubDfSb5B08z1W40kvgGlg.text: If I could give this place a 10 I would! The Carne Asada Street Tacos with beans and rice are delicious! The place was spotless and cozy. The service was fast and friendly. I will be back again and again.  I'm craving those tacos right now

1XJ-tjFNZYplG3Kbwadg1A.text: Win!  We were recommeded to try this place by Mr. Guy Fieri and Diners, Drive-ins and Dives.  Previously we'd had some misses with his recommendations.  Turns out this place is pretty kick ass.  Simple menu items and very affordably priced.  Now you're asking... how does it taste?  Ah. Mazing.  Got gitchya some.

ovHFiVf-xBnF0vTgTYS4OA.text: Worth a visit. The 4/5 is mostly based on the chips and salsa being $2.50, small in quantity, and not all that great. The Carne Asada burrito was outstanding. The red chile beef enchilada was outstanding. The chorizo breakfast burrito was plentiful but lacked the spice and full flavor that I like out of my chorizo. The marinated pork burrito deep fried and smothered in red sauce was a bit on the sweet side for Mexican cuisine but it was good and, like everything else, big enough to get all the value out of the price paid. We didn't partake in the bar offerings but the margaritas tempted me. We also dropped the ball on looking around before ordering as we missed the specials board for Taco Tuesday at a buck a piece. The value was great and we will be back to try the red chile beef and green chile pork burritos. Glad we finally tried this place after living close by for more than 2 years.

D1FYUkUwPykpIjJmD0OR_Q.text: I love this place, come here almost every week. Fast, cheap, casual and delicious. If you are looking for fancy Mexican this is not the place.  Their margaritas are delicious, maybe a bit small.

rtbBSlmQIIlOqae93S4W5w.text: Soo good and fresh.  The staff was very helpful in our selecton of specials and little bites.  Yummmm!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-ssQqTmNNdNtb6oj56jWEQ.text: I want to like this place, but three incorrect takeout orders leave me looking for another place close to home.  Asada not chorizo breakfast burritos, burnt chips, no salsa, missing flan (which was delicious when I went back for it the next day). Great pastor street tacos! Check your order before you leave. Especially when it's busy.

vXnWo7DyBQ0V8hmiFPq57A.text: We stopped by here for the street tacos as the highly recommended by many yelpers.  Overall this place was average. We had both the Pollo tacos and the asada  tacos. They were exactly what you expect. Very straightfoward flavors. were tasty but nothing amazing. The Guacamole was good but again nothing amazing.  Price was about $8 for three small street tacos, no sides,  and was a good lunch portion. Again reasonably priced but not a great deal.  There are other taco shops in the area that I would go to before this one (Santos Lucha Libre)

BuJoM79U0ATVsr92P0qwWw.text: Viva Los Taquitos! Go to Los Taq for what they are - a walk-up restaurant with fun atmosphere, limited service and amazing food. Our favorites to grab and go: Chicken or Carne Asada burritos. Eating in: LOVE me some chicken tostada - the best I've had! Carne Torta is to die for either way, as is their Pico de Gallo! I've used Los Taq to cater too (pick up) and was thrilled with the experience. A note for those who are looking for the "Cheers" environment: My husband and i are there anywhere from 2-5 times per week. If the ladies at the counter don't know us, we simply take an interest in getting to know them! Nothing will come between me and my tostada!

JrBd4efYBuiRmhjonqR6YA.text: For a small establishment, this place rocks! I crave their vegetarian burrito and need it regularly. Their salsa is amazing. I have been really happy with all the food I have got. Well done!

_aD5uTQG6Gh9sBOYW3oTzQ.text: I went to this place because of the reviews. Maybe my expectations were too high. My usual standard that I judge a Mexican restaurant by are its chips/salsa and a beef burrito. I have to say the chips were some of the worse chips I have ever had. They were extremely dry and seemed old. The salsa was more of a pico and again very dry. Mostly chopped tomato and onion. The burrito could not have been more disappointing. The tortilla again seemed old and dry (sorry about the theme here...but dry was the theme of the night) and while I ordered the burrito wet, not only did they not put enough sauce on it, the flavor was mediocre. The beef was actually pretty good, but again...a little dry.

rMQq61HJY74WZSw04qifBw.text: I always forget how much I love this little slice of heaven until I walk through the unassuming door and voialla, "oh yeah, that's right, this place rocks!" It seems many more folks have found this hidden gem because they were super slammed at lunch today. Service was still friendly and fast! Winning!

lHwjwk0FsMoq-qMW7aeJBw.text: Gotta love it when fellow Foodies put together tweetups that involve food and drink, even better when that get together happens at a restaurant featured on Diners, Drive-ins & Dives that you've wanted to try out for ages.  Kirti Dwivedi and Susie Timm decided to gather tweeps at the grand opening of Los Taquitos' newest location on 16th and Glendale avenues in Mid-town Phoenix for a nosh and adult beverages. Thirty or so twitter and Facebook users responded to the tweetvite, showed up, queued up and got down to the business of eating.  First up a margarita made with Tres Agaves tequila and freshly squeezed Blood orange juice. I'm a big fan of the tangy sweetness of blood  oranges and am glad to see them used in this upscale taqueria.  The much talked about 'Bombiero' burrito was served up as my entree, full of slow cooked carnitas, pico de gallo, and rice wrapped in a flour tortilla and bathed in Los Taquitos signature sweet and fiery 'Bombiero' sauce.  I found the pork to be perfectly cooked, tender and juicy, the pico fresh and vibrant but the sauce was a bit overpowering in it's sweetness. I was really looking for this sauce to have a much higher level of heat and spice, but over-all, sweet was the strongest note that I experienced. In my opinion, this sauce would be perfect if the sweetness was dialed down and the heat increased.  Other tweeps at my table enjoyed their carne asada tacos with rice and beans and we all munched on that taco shop staple, chips and salsa/guacamole. I'm looking forward to trying several other dishes including the tacos al pastor and am quite happy that Los Taquitos has opened up on my side of the valley.  If you fancy a bit of up-scale taqueria cuisine, get to one of Los Taquitos' locations and have a go at the menu, you'll certainly not be disappointed.

PiwHs5kD1JbmSOypm-l66g.text: I was excited when I saw that this place offered street tacos.  As a result I ordered 6 total tacos, carne asada, carnitas and pollo.  I would have given this place 3.5 stars after trying the pollo and carnitas tacos.  They are fresh and great tasting.  The carnitas was a bit too salty.    The horchata was a bit too sweet as well, so overall, 3 stars is a good amount.

WuLT7GrOyP2IMotSQk-2hQ.text: I love Los Taquitos! A friend showed it to me at the beginning of 2014 and I've gone about once a week since then. Big fan of the carnitas tacos (ask for some lime and jalapenos to add on) and the AZ burro. Definitely check it out if you're in the area and craving some Mexican food. Also, $1 street tacos on Tuesdays - can't beat that!

UfW4y7gTfaRpEkLi1zM5xg.text: A great little place. Super food, lively service, and fast service for lunch. They also have options for vegetarians which is sometimes hard to find at some Mex restaurants.

mCrsNEVvzus_aBuJA_L5nw.text: Tried Los Taquitos for the first time today.  The street tacos were amazing!  We had the carnitas and the pastor tacos - both were delicious.  And the refried beans were light and yummy!  We'll be back!

9_Q6aOp_q5QKOMHqse7Uiw.text: The tacos were amazing and service was friendly. The street tacos are some of the closest to authentic Mexican tacos that I have found in the valley - and I have spent months in Mexico. I ended up with 6 tasty tacos; sample them all if you can!  Prices and food quality makes this a 5 star place.

EaZ9HgNP_5-WaiUYJbbR2A.text: Wow! The food was fabulous and the restaurant was clean and well decorated. Overall, great ambiance. ( we loved the music and art) This is no dive spot.  It's the real deal at a great price.  We will definitely be going back and taking out of town guests for some authentic Mexican food, Phoenix style.

vbA5LUvGXxg7p80AFlAI8A.text: Carne asada and shrimp tacos are amazing! Tortas are also very good!

_H0Xaqj90SbXs1HXEfT4jA.text: I love this place! It's right down the street from my apartment so I order to go all the time and everything I've tried is so good! Their pasole is fantastic so is their Bombero burrito. I tried the El Pastor taco today and it was the best I've ever had!

PkaA0-Fc-WCafGKnbr3PUQ.text: A good friend of mine brought me here yesterday after raving about the amazing street tacos and salsa. I'm always down for good Mexican food so we hopped in the Mom-mobile and were on our way!   I ordered the Friday special which was 2 hand tacos with choice of rice or beans. You could choose chicken or beef and I asked for one of each and asked for a side of beans as well as I wanted to get the full flavor. My friend had the street tacos pastor, asado, and carnitas style.We also shared chips and salsa with guacamole.  I ended up getting 2 beef tacos and no beans. I didn't want to make a stink about it because I didn't pick the restaurant but when I asked at the counter about the beans, they said they would bring them out and never did. Luckily my baby had beans with his cheese quesadilla so I did get to try them but meh..they were just ok. The spanish rice was under-seasoned and all I could taste was salty chicken broth. The guacamole was pretty tasty though the avocado was overpowered by the salsa that was mixed in to it. The salsa was very tasty. And I was kind of surprised that the chips and the hard shells on the tacos weren't house made or if they were...they've got it down to such a science that they seem store bought.   My friend enjoyed his street tacos but he agreed about the rice being under-seasoned and over-brothed.   The staff at the counter were nice, but they were firmly planted there. No one came by the tables to check on people and even though we chose to sit outside, they didn't move from their spot to let us know our food was ready.   I'll go back to try again if we are in the area because my friend really likes it there and I want to try to get what he's seeing but I can't say I'd go out of my way to go back without him.

h4-RQTY7KVqUVP6rTcK1SA.text: I was craving tacos and decided to stop in for lunch during the work week since I'm not far away from Los Taquitos. I had the 3 taco plate with rice and beans. I had the carne asada tacos and everything was very tasty! Service was good and I will be back very soon!!

jgx1n6qUAqpc9xcVmRkO3Q.text: Stumbled upon Los Taquitos while staying at a hotel nearby, not realizing it was a local favorite. Delicious tacos! Carne asada was super flavorful and the sauce was spicy and delicious. Chips and salsa was good, not great, but it was a great meal none the less. Very cute interior and the staff was friendly too.

QyC_8zpJFCbvFhWfrgDMnQ.text: Some of the best tacos in the valley.  Asada, pastor, shrimp, and fish tacos are amazing, and the made in house corn tortillas just complete the masterpiece.  Nothing more to say than just eat here!

BZ5N_GWo4xpyqMDwT9fwJQ.text: Love this place. Carnitas street tacos are my fav! Everything here is great. The pickled carrots are also a must!!!!!

-38ClvyDQXEfCHMaAOF4ow.text: Excellent food and great service! I had the pollo az burrito meal and it was excellente!

lT6U5ZcNvUcUBsXLv1JgOw.text: Delicious. I try not to use that word lightly, but it definitely applies to the food in this place. The seasoning of the meat, the taste and texture of the beans and the rice, the kick of the salsas - everything is the way it should be. The staff is very friendly and the list of offerings is in plain sight, on a chalkboard menu above the counter area. Prices are great! The place is clean and has a very relaxed atmosphere (and the Food Network on the flatscreen at the bar during lunchtime ... very sneaky way of encouraging a big appetite). Nice bar area, and even an outdoor al fresco dining area where you have a view of the Phoenix Mountains. Lots of things to like about this place!

iltzqvk6Nko0yyGTweVO8w.text: Our food was very fresh and flavorful. I'm a vegetarian; the rest of my family is not. Everyone, including the kids, was happy with their dishes.  Delicious, inexpensive, quick. After a long day of travel, this place was perfect.

zm-VAW3QTL09tyAYOZjVxw.text: I've been to this restaurant several times. It's tucked into the corner of an unassuming strip mall but the food was delicious. I've had a variety of street tacos: asada, pastor, carnitas, fish, and shrimp (what can I say, I love tacos) with a side of rice and beans. All were enjoyable. The food was ready in a reasonable time and the restaurant wasn't too busy. Unfortunately the seating is limited and there are no comfy booths. Also, the ambiance is a little bland. But I will definitely return in the future and recommend to anyone.

nJCVXfTv8d3XccMi8haapA.text: We go to Los Taquitos weekly at a minimum post-workout.  The staff is all very friendly and we're always treated very well.  We usually split a breakfast burrito (no potatoes or meat, with added jalapenos) and a side of rice and beans - more than enough food.  Their margaritas are freshly made and delicious, as well!  I highly recommend!

xlY4hOq09d7_OjjIP3-aNA.text: Carne Asada Quesadilla was pretty tasty and prices are fair for what your getting. They also do breakfast.

WUcT9odigcJrbB9QW1OG7g.text: Burrito was great and the breakfast quesidilla had a nice flavor.  However the customer service was extremely poor.  All I asked for was some salsa for the burrito and she told me it cost extra but I'll bring to you in a few minutes.  There was only three customer in the restaurant at this time.  I ask again, and she say you want the chips...  Finally a lady comes out of the back with the tray of squeeze salsa for burritos etc.  Register lady didn't seem to understand me. utqVzbGqF7je5Sb0NxaDlA.text: One of my favorite spots inPhoenix to grab a good bite to eat and a good marg. taco tues is one of the best deals around.. They also have items that are not on the menu... So ask about them .. I will get the veggie burrito  add a protein and smother it in green sauce for a special treat

4u35UxwWv47drI-de_hfUg.text: I really love when I go to a restaurant and I am able to get a unique flavor that I can't find anywhere else. This love of mine gets harder and harder as I try more Mexican restaurants here in Phoenix. Los Taquitos reassures me that these places still exist though, and they do it with the Bombero. The Bombero's sauce is an enchilada-style kind of sauce with the twist of ketchup tang. It threw me off a little at first because I didn't know exactly what to expect, but as I munched on each bite, and the spiciness of the sauce began to take over, I knew that my taste buds had made a new friend. The al pastor and the chips were also very tasty, but I don't think many people will be blown away with those items like I was with the Bombero.   I also want to add that the staff was extremely friendly during my visit. The cashier walked me through what I should try (recommending the Bombero if I was a fan of heat) and she didn't once seem impatient. That's always a huge plus to me.   I'll definitely be back soon! I already find myself craving that Bombero sauce. You should definitely check Los Taquitos out if you're in the neighborhood. It's solid Mexican food at decent prices. If they add a happy hour, this will definitely be a busy spot! Next up for me, the original location!

jQ5VZucIuM_prjEqrWgfpw.text: I came here on a whim to just try out. It wasn't quite lunch time but wasn't technically breakfast either so I thought I would stop in and see what they had since I was starving. Walking in it's nicely sized. Very clean and not overpowering with stuff everywhere. They have some vintage style lights hanging in the restaurant which give it a nice little touch. Heading to the counter you are warmly greeted by the person behind the register. She asked "would you like breakfast or lunch?" First of all I didn't know they served breakfast but I was sure glad they did! I had the breakfast quesadilla which was... as simply as I can put it... AMAZING!!! very flavorful and good. It is spicy so if you don't like spicy then maybe you can ask them to keep the jalapenos off. I can't wait to try their lunch menu food! If you live in the area and are looking for really good Mexican food then you HAVE to try this place!

94mz-9dBRusVa5tcCjKDXg.text: Service, just awful. We ordered meals and were told we get no drinks. Then we overheard the same woman offer small drinks to a gentleman because meals come with drinks. I don't even care about the food, that type of dishonesty will not take my money.

3isYleigwOPoB4e0ptQFlg.text: Mouthwaaaaatering! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu and they have awesome happy hour deals with $1 tacos- Carnitas, Chicken, and Pastor. Their beans are bomb & their Asada Nachos are great. Good drink specials too if that's your thing!  *UPDATE* My previous review on this place NO LONGER APPLIES. They increased the taco Tuesday special price from $1 to $1.35 per taco, no biggie IF THE TACOS WERE WORTH THE INCREASE ...but they're not. Things taste different, the carnitas were full of fat chunks and cartilage/ nerves. Who wants to bite into that while trying to enjoy their tacos? NOT I. The pastor tacos were drenched in some sort of red grease sauce- completely and entirely different from before. You can taste where this restaurant has cut CORNER$. Never going back again, I'm sure you have many customers but you definitely just lost a handful!

Best breakfast burrito I've ever had. Best corn tortillas I've ever had (I usually hate them).  Overall, my new favorite place for tacos and breakfast burritos.

3DpIQuEf-evJwfnZ-sNcRw.text: First of all, don't try to actually order TAQUITOS, because they don't have any. They told us they only have flautas. The super nachos with carne asada were really good, the burrito and the street tacos were ok; but the hard shell taco and tostada were a big disappointment because they had store bought shells. The staff was friendly. The dining area was clean and comfortable.

MnJdBVqM6UUmZgs6igwAkQ.text: This was a popular spot during the time I was here. It seemed like the whole conference loved this place. I think it was the cheap price and the fast lunch that allured them here. This is definitely a take out or dine in spot, it's fast, and they basically have it set up like a fast food chain. You get in line, go to the counter, order, you get a number if you are eating there, then pick a seat. Seats are limited, so if there's a ton of people there is a chance that you probably won't get a seat.   Now, to the food. I ordered the Pastor Burrito and I got it smothered. Don't follow my footsteps and get it smothered. Get it plain, if you want the sauce, get it on the side because to me it took all the flavor of the pastor in the burrito and the overall taste out of it and you're just eating a burrito drenched in sauce. The overall pastor was good, I wish that I never got it smothered and just got it on the side. On the other hand, the fish tacos were good which I would recommend if that's what you want.  Overall, this place was good. Great place for quick lunches. Nothing exciting or memorable other than the option to smother the sauce all over the burrito. Check it out if you're low on time and want some quick Mexican food.

ijGprHZF-KAKWtaShyWpJA.text: The BEST carnitas tacos in town (and I've done a pretty substantial tour de taco) they are so friendly, have a great atmosphere and $1 tacos all Tuesday and during happy hour can't beat it!

HS_y9lL2W5YlGpqKDkc2uQ.text: Not very good. I ordered the daily special, 2 hard tacos with beans. The hard taco shells may have been Old El Paso, I'm not 100% sure but they sure tasted like cheap store-brand shells. Very little meat that was way over-cooked to the point that it lost it's identity. About 2 shreds of lettuce (seriously), 1tsp of cheese (which I swear was a supermarket blend like Mexican Cheese Blend), and 2-3 tomato pieces. Very unappetizing.  The beans has an odd taste of beef tallow. Not the good kind of fat like lard, but an off-putting taste that didn't compliment the beans runny consistency.  My friend ordered the street tacos which looked better. But they said they were nothing special. My other friend had a torta and wouldn't finish it.  Oh, and they lost our order, and other customers that were there as well. I had to remind them of our order and show them our receipt as they had no record of our purchase. Over 20 minutes to get our food.  On the plus side the decor was very mexi-hipster.

Gv2pBnrjp2-r5bP3gIBQ_w.text: Disgusting! I had been wanting to try this place for months. When I finally did, I asked what was the most popular, so the girl suggested the smothered burrito. I asked what the difference was between the green and red sauce, is one more hot? She said the only difference was the color! Um, ok? So I tried the red. When I got it, it looked like a burrito in red soup. Completely soggy. But I quickly realized it had to be just so the hard, stale tortilla seemed normal! The "chicken" was dry and bland as well. My friend tried the street tacos which were dry and bland as well. And Filabertos has better taquitos than this place! Its like they just used their left overs that day. DONT GO THERE!!!

EMc3mzfBUNi_aubXc3ksdg.text: This is a great little neighborhood spot to grab a quick and delicious Mexican bite to eat. Order at the counter and they'll call your number when your food is up. I went for the street tacos...al pastor and chicken. The tacos al pastor were terrific, with a rich, spicy sauce on the tender pork. The chicken also had a spicy marinade; both were double wrapped in perfect little corn tortillas. The salsa bar has 2 types of yummy home made salsa...red and green...as well as some pickled veggies and fresh lime with which to flavor your food. I got 3 tacos, rice and beans and a fountain drink for under $10. Nice.

BmBlqDbW4_1weY_GkjKF_Q.text: Loved it! So Rich and flavorful. Not expensive. I got the burrito in a bowl which is different than a burrito bowl because the burrito in a bowl has pinto beans and no rice. I got take out and ended up adding rice to the bowl when I got back to my room. My fault not theirs. Definitely delicious and worth multiple trips. I will be back

hXHCFIkmcmsxXY2399XlGA.text: We go here often because it's right by our house and also because the food is really good and nicely priced. We kind of have our regulars now: I'll always get the carne asada tacos and my wife will order the fish tacos and neither of those (sides included) ever seems to disappoint.   We did venture from our favorites in the beginning and everything we had was still good but we settled on our usuals. The only menu item we didn't really enjoy was the enchiladas. They weren't horrible but definitely not anything we'd order again. It's also pretty tough to make good enchiladas in a short amount of time though (IMO).   Overall, good cheap taco spot with some amazing rice as well!

9sHSeRsbdnpC1QdD5efIsA.text: Had it yesterday.  It was good.   I asked for a carnitas burrito but got a a different burro though in my bag to go.  It was a shredded beef one.   It was good though.  Good thing.   Their chorizo quesadilla was great.

Lwm9GipcCY_561YshB2KVg.text: Awsome place. Guy Fieri never makes mistakes. Love his show and everywhere i go i google places he recommends. Food is very delicious. Fast service and great atmosphere. If you are in Phoenix you must visit this place!

LYvJQOpgCvlgzG5pRYtm-w.text: Sweet Jesus, yum. Carne Asada Quesdilla with extra cheese. Grab a bottle of their exquisite green hot sauce and you're in heaven. I'd sell my soul to have a lifetime guaranteed supply. Oh, and cheap, too! Oh, their beans are friggin insane...

Or1pf5431ia7iOfWtJ16NQ.text: We make a point of eating here once or twice each time we visit the Phoenix area. We love their happy hour with $4 house margaritas and $1 pollo and pastor street tacos.  Even outside happy hour their prices are outstanding.  Over the years we have enjoyed everything we ordered.   Last night's meal was no exception.  The atmosphere is friendly with your order taken at the counter and food delivered to your table.

PXTAtJKhVnbE-bnn-LXXkg.text: I used to eat at Los Taquitos frequently, but after asking several times about the ingredients in the tortillas (to determine if they are vegan) and not getting a straight answer, I took a pass at going here for a few years. But, I asked again recently and finally got answers! No, the tortillas are not vegan, but so much else is! See the photo I posted for details.   My go-to order now is the bean tostada with no cheese. It's perfect! The re-fried beans are delicious, and the shells are crisp and fresh. It's also easy to take to-go. I love the chips and very spicy salsa (pico) and their hot sauces (green and red). I've also tried the enchiladas with veggies (no cheese), rice and veggie tacos. The veggies are mostly onions, peppers and potatoes and it's great to find Mexican-style rice that doesn't have chicken broth. I miss the bean & veggie burrito, but am glad I can have so many other great items! Los Taquitos is back to being my go-to place for a quick and delicious authentic (yet vegan) Mexican meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan options at Los Taquitos!

xwaA7ERlPAtywx7zujXaww.text: Visiting from DC for a military conference and was looking for some legit tacos. So hard to find in DC, the best ones are in Cali & AZ! Carne Asada, pollo and el pastor was delicousssss! Very well seasoned. I will say they are small & at a 1.75 each, the portion in Cali are bigger for just a dollar.  My group really enjoyed theirs as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos
Photo of Los Taquitos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos

pdHUAWoEGNvqssMJBWV75w.text: My buddy Bill took us to the one in Awahtukee a few months back, and I thought it was fantastic!  My buddy and I were out and about and wanted something to eat, but nothing too big since we were going to dinner later that night.  Tacos, it is!  We made our way down here and walked inside.   I went with 3 carne asada tacos, and an order of chips and guacamole.   Right around $10.00.  You pay at the counter, grab a seat and then they call your number when its ready.  Here is how everything was..............  3 Carne Asada Tacos-  Bomb!  Straight up, BOMB!  The carne asada here is probably the best carne asada I have found yet in Phoenix.  It reminds me of some of my favorite joints down in Tijuana/San Diego that cook the meat over mesquite charcoal.  It hits the meat with that great smokey flavor and just makes it taste so much better than something done on a flat top or on a regular propane grill.  The flavor is very unique, and I was happy as hell when I first bit in.  The tacos here are a bit small, but I savored every single bite of my 3 tacos.  No joke, I could probably eat 10-15 in one sitting.  Yeah, that good!   Chips and Guacamole-  Eh...just ok.  Chips were decent.  Nothing special.  Guacamole was a little too pureed for my liking.  Didn't taste bad or anything, just too smooth for my liking and didn't have the most flavor.  Have had way better guacamole elsewhere.    Overall, not as good as the Awahtukee spot, but still pretty damn tasty for some Phoenix tacos.  That carne asada is the best...that's all you really need to know/order from here.  So damn good!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Asada Tacos, chips and guacamole.  Tacos-BOMB!  Chips and guacamole- just ok.  Get the Carne Asada!   Smokey and full of flavor!

ZYT9_LF2GDuV6cJQS1H5Xw.text: On a whim, decided to host a swim party and wanted to have tacos... cuz, y'know, TACOS! But I knew they'd get soggy and fall apart before we were ready to eat if I brought them home right away... so we got everything in broken down form catering style, ALL IN ABOUT 10 MINUTES! Everyone loved them and I looked like the hero. LOVE THIS PLACE AND THE FAMILY THAT RUNS IT! Thanks Los Taquitos and I'll see you again, Tuesday

O4YXuws1PuRur7az77PueA.text: Los Taquitos has amazing employees who are always very nice. I typically go for the torta and a nice horchata. Very good!

w-sBCD_QTLsoUOgkzw_TEQ.text: They make a great breakfast burrito.  It seems like a great family run restaurant that started in Ahwatukee and now has expanded quite a bit.  I do not think the quality has suffered for it.  The green chile pork burrito is one of my favorites.  The salsa is delicious just seems one day the green is hot and other days much more mild...still good, I just always want the heat.

c_fgmv8WiCO85vtsjvqvmA.text: I love this place!  You can't find better Mexican food for the money anywhere.  The bombero burrito is my favorite thing on the menu, but everything here is really good.  Their breakfast burritos are also incredible.

cDOFyrrKoOXeMRVicTlvzQ.text: This restaurant is so cute and close to my house. My partner and I come in all the time. I love that they have vegetarian options for me! All the employees are very nice and welcoming. Their food is delicious and it's a fair price. I need to try their margaritas and breakfast ASAP. Definitely worth checking out (-: thanks for being amazing guys!!!!

dTnlI7u1_ANj6TKcAKXk6w.text: Taco Tuesday go to!  1.30 for 3 types of street tacos, Chicken, pastor and carnitas.  Can't beat that with a stick!  I mean you probably could but then you would be beating delicious tacos with a stick and who really wants that?  Tacos are for eating not beating.  I normally get 5 or 6 of the tacos on tuesday and leave quite full all for under 10 bucks.  The hot sauce they offer is flavorful and not overpowering with spice so you can taste all the flavors.  I've had a few other items on their menu, on the random times I come here not on Tuesday and nothing has disappointed!

xP0yVAHJ-GeQnljYw9dEFg.text: I've driven past this old, 80's Walgreen's strip center for years. I've always wanted to try these tacos but couldn't get myself in. Eventually my tastebuds overcame my architectural, design minded self and walked in.....only to find a pleasant and palatable interior. From there my tacos were awesome and reasonably priced. Even took my wife there who makes homemade orchata and their orchata passed the test......trust me she is a tough grader and can critique the blue sky.

o-6go471aIt1ox5szAPJzQ.text: Despite looking like a fast food place, the food was surprisingly good. Once again, the Yelp ratings were spot on!  While it wasn't cheap and it's definitely not as fast as a Taco Bell, the food was excellent and authentic for the area so we really enjoyed it.   I'd definitely go back and highly recommend it.

8sxzJbmcsqFAEuZv1Mpk0g.text: Yuck. This place is dirty. There was a cockroach in the ice dispenser of the soda machine. We alerted the staff and was met with laughter. They did nothing about it. We talked to the staff a second time, still no response. The third time one of the employees said, "You act like you've never see a cockroach before." The food here is not great and the place is not clean. The bathroom was messy and the trash was leaking on the floor into the dining area.

D39iENyfDVBntcAG-jY7uw.text: I can't say enough about this little gem. They have the best carne asada street tacos. I am in love! The green chili pork is so flavorful- everything is delicious. The staff are so nice and everything is reasonably priced.

ZlKiVsCEllseSYTk4fhk8g.text: Best tacos in town!! My husband brought me here for the first time tonight and I'm in love. Carne asada and pollo street tacos with cheese were BOMB! We also had a chicken quesadilla that was to die!  Love the girls at the register too. They were so polite and kind. I couldn't have asked for a better experience. Thank You Los Taquitos!!!!

nucgD5GBDZqizhMLv-rtGA.text: Not memorable at all. The tacos were ok, I guess. The guacamole literally looks and tastes like it comes out of a pre bought package. The salsa they have on their menu isn't even salsa. It's pico de Gallo, and that also looks and tastes like they bought it from Costco or something.   I feel like I did get what I paid for. However, in Arizona where we have SO many good Mexican and tacos places, this place failed to leave an impression. If you want some good tacos or Mexican food that will have you wanting to come back for more, try taco chelo, la santisima, presidio Cafe, or casa corazon.

vCyjuKLHI-s2dKMOfCfyaQ.text: Some of the best street tacos I've had! The pastor and asada are fantastic. Clean and spacious restaurant with a great staff and even better food!

YU7szRd7S-F78FQ4Ko4hmg.text: This place is great for family and inviting friends!  The food is filling and delicious!   The only thing I can't find is the nutrition but I don't care cause I use this place as my cheat day! Love the variety and their green hot sauce and red chipotle sauce is to die for! This is my second time here and I'm definitely coming back!   Ask for their pickled carrots! They are delicious!  They also have some very sweet and refreshing Mexican waters! Prices are reasonable and portions are fair. The girls at the cash register are always sweet and smiling!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I love this TORTA!! &#34;It was heaven&#34; -her words
Photo of Los Taquitos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastor torta
Photo of Los Taquitos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious JAMAICA

5T83pyJKoROVuJ8TKKTmAQ.text: This visit was a long time coming. My husband has came home from work a few times saying he got the BEST street tacos for $1 each on taco Tuesdays for lunch. So as we're starving on a Friday night deciding what is for dinner, what a great time to try those amazing tacos I have been hearing so much about.   Once you walk in, it's a small restaurant with tables, a small bar, and a little patio. You walk up to order and then they call your number when it's ready. So great place for a quick Mexican dinner or take-out. No salsa bar and no sit down service.   When we first walked in, the girl at register Elisa, just stared at us so we began to order and she just said "ok, what else?" No welcome, no have you been here before, no how may I help you.... Frankly she had no personality and may have been the most miserable person I have ever met. Cheer up buttercup! My husband was surprised because all the other ladies previously have been very nice to him.   So erasing the first impression the lady at the register gave me, I moved on to the food with a clean slate. I got the 3 street taco combo with 1 carnitas, 1 carne asada, and 1 el pastor. They were all super good! All the meat was very  juicy and flavorful. The El Pastor was my favorite! Very good with so much flavorful. The carnitas was my second favorite. I added sour cream and their green sauce which made it over the top good. The rice and beans were simple but good.   Overall I'm hoping the service is normally better but the food was really good and came out quick. I will be back for more and recommend to others.
